page.title: 03ECOLOGY_INCLUDING GEOLOGY
page.content: THE{ECOLOGY}OF THE SALTASH AREA IS DOMINATED BY THE TAMAR AND LYNHER RIVERS AND THE LOCAL ROCK.THERE IS A TYPICAL CORNISH VARIETY OF WILDLIFE, WITH A GREAT NUMBER OF BIRD AND WATER ANIMALS BECAUSE OF THE TWO RIVERS AND THE NEARBY ESTUARY.AMONG THE BIRDS COMMONLY SEEN ARE REDSHANK,MANY MEMBERS OF THE GULL FAMILY,MUTE SWAN AND OTHER WADING BIRDS INCLUDING OYSTERCATCHER AND CURLEW.THE AREA HAS A FAIRLY TYPICAL ANIMAL POPULATION FOR THIS PART OF CORNWALL.THERE ARE MANY WATERSIDE PLANTS TO BE FOUND,THE COMMON WINTERCRESS AND HEMLOCK WATER DROPWORT AMONG THEM.SALTASH AND ITS SURROUNDING COUNTRYSIDE IS SITUATED ON AN AREA OF SLATE ROCK,KNOWN LOCALLY AS SHALE.THE MAIN STREET OF THE TOWN IS BUILT ON AN OUTCROP OF VOLCANIC ROCK, ABOUT 3000M BY 500M IN AREA,RUNNING EAST_WEST.THE HIGHEST ELEVATION IS 76M
